intro: Euphrasia minima subsp. pulchella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent yellow spots. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
